senses.sense_definition: Persuasive flattery, charm, or smooth talk used to influence or deceive someone gently.

examples.text: He used his Irish <w>blarney</w> to talk his way out of a speeding ticket.
Don't be fooled by his <w>blarney</w>; he just wants you to sign the contract.

senses.sense_definition: Talk that is considered foolish, untrue, or meaningless.

examples.text: Everything he said about being a millionaire was just pure <w>blarney</w>.
I know you are full of <w>blarney</w>, so stop trying to trick me.

senses.sense_definition: To persuade or deceive someone using charming and flattering talk.

examples.text: She managed to <w>blarney</w> her way past the security guard without an ID.
He tried to <w>blarney</w> the teacher into giving him an extension on the essay.

senses.sense_definition: A town in County Cork, Ireland, famous for its castle and a stone said to give the gift of eloquence.

examples.text: Tourists flock to <w>Blarney</w> every year to kiss the famous stone.
We visited the castle in <w>Blarney</w> during our summer trip to Ireland.
